Presentative language presents (= introduces) information: In Spanish, "haber" is a verb that has a presentative function. We will simply assume that the semantic goal of a noun phrase is presentative.
More examplesFewer examplesThey reported on an English boy who used multisyllabic fillers to introduce presentative statements.In a subsequent step, the indefinite article loses its presentative function and extends to all specific, referential nouns.Presentative constructions are most frequent in French for the introduction and reintroduction of referents.
